user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: This screenshot displays the Google Photos interface, showing various options for viewing and organizing media. The options include Videos, Movies, Animations, Collages, Creations, PhotoScan, and Motion Photos. The "Search your photos" bar is located at the top for easy navigation. A "Show less" link is available at the bottom to collapse the list.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.
click on the "Settings" located at the middle left.
click on the back button "<-" located at the top-left.
click on the "Search your photos" bar located at the top.
click on the "Show more" text located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.

think_action.Thought: The user is looking to view the 'Creations' section in Google Photos. The 'Creations' option is already visible in the current menu. Since the user has previously interacted with the search bar and the 'Show more' link, it seems like they are navigating through the options to find their 'Creations'. Therefore, the next step is to select the 'Creations' option to view the relevant content.
Future Action Plan: Click on the 'Creations' option in the Google Photos menu.
Wait for the 'Creations' section to load, displaying the user's saved creations.
